manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Essentials Essentials was created with a single goal in mind: to provide the highest-quality personal care products possible. Made with only premium-quality ingredients, the Essentials line of products offers a gentle way to care for your body. Essentials products leave the skin clean, refreshed, nourished, and moisturized. We are cruelty-free, using no animal by-products, and contain no parabens, gluten, or petroleum-based ingredients. We're non-GMO. Be Nice to Your Skin! Essentials Glycerin Bar Soap - Unscented Enriched with glycerin, Essentials Glycerin Bar Soap leaves skin clean, refreshed and moisturized. Say Bye to Dry Skin and Yes to Deeply Nourished and Hydrated skin. Unscented - free of fragrance and dyes No parabens, petroleum-based ingredients, animal by-products Cruelty-Free Maintains skin's pH balance No Clogging Pores Pack of 3

Long-Lasting Hydration This soap protects and maintains skin's pH balance after rinsing clean and leaves no sticky residue. It locks the nourishment and moisture in your skin for a longer time for that extra-smooth feel. With Essentials, you will see the Difference This glycerin bar soap not only smells wonderful, but they are non-drying and rinse of easily. Clean your skin without clogging your pores. Cruelty-Free These soaps contain no parabens, petroleum-based ingredients, animal by-products, and are cruelty-free. These individual wrapped soaps are great to spread around your house.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Does NOT bother my allergies or dry out my skin and works. However, not much suds, and only mostly scent-free.
reviews.reviewText: This is a mixed review but overall it gets 5-stars because after buying many different brands and types of similar soaps, I can't find anything better that meets all my primary criteria, thus reasons I'm giving it 5-stars are as follows:- It did not bother my allergies at all whatsoever,- It does not have perfume of any type listed or that I can smell,- It only has 5 natural ingredients vs other brands with a long list of weird stuff,- It actually works and gets you clean,- It does not dry out my skin probably because 1 of its 5 ingredients is vegetable oil believe it or not (and no, it does NOT feel oily at all whatsoever).Okay now the not-so-great part of my "mixed" review:- This Unscented version is not 100% truly scent-free, but its 99%. I'm guessing this is because either the glycerine itself or one of its other 4 ingredients has a slight normal/natural smell, but it's very subtle and quickly fades away.- This Clearly Natural glycerine soap does not produce much suds or lather, but that didn't bother me as much as I thought it would. However IF this was a shampoo, the lack of lathering would probably bother me a lot.As an aside, Yes I tried several other variations of the Clearly Natural glycerine soaps, THIS Unscented is obviously what they're known for and is their best soap: Their Aloe Vera and Vitamin-E versions have more ingredients and too strong of an odd/weird odor.Overall if you have sensitive skin and bad allergies like me you should consider it, and I'm glad I gave this a try.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Bar none, the best soap I've ever used
reviews.reviewText: I'm so glad I found this product. I have sensitive skin and the harsh chemicals and fragrances found in other soaps aggravate my skin and leave me feeling like the dead sea scrolls. Clearly Natural does what it says on the tin. It leaves my skin feeling clean and soft, with no heavy residue. I use it as an all-over-body soap, including on my face, and it hasn't led to any breakouts. Bar none, it's the best soap I've ever used.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Feel and smell.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Not a great scent
reviews.reviewText: I was expecting honeysuckle scent but it smells like unscented, which isn't the nicest smell, but isn't the worst. Other than that, I love this soap. I love that it's so transparent, like glass. The feel of this soap on my hands is pure luxury, so silky smooth. It leaves my face feeling so soft, no drying, no oily feeling at all. I might buy again in the aloe version.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great price and quality
reviews.reviewText: I have been using this soap for a while and it helped me to maintain my skin without itch problems

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Gentle and Moisturizing but bar dissolves rapidly
reviews.reviewText: This soap is truly unscented, doesn't leave residue, and is moisturizing and good for sensitive skin. However, it is very greasy, even in the package, and the bar dissolves and goes away much faster than other soaps. Glad it's made in the USA, but it can be improved.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars No soap scum
reviews.reviewText: I like this soap for 3 reasons Since it’s glycerine, it doesn’t coat my shower with soap scum. Since it’s clear, it doesn’t leave brown residue on the soap dish like the brown glycerine bars. The packaging is minimal, unlike the liquid glycerine soaps that come in large plastic pump bottles, and wind up in the landfill.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars SMELLS LIKE A CRAYOLA CRAYON
reviews.reviewText: I'm afraid this particular brand of glycerin soap did NOT work for me (unscented). It smells like your sniffing a box of Crayola crayons and the soap DOES NOT LATHER. At all. You can try and make it lather for several whole minutes and you'd be lucky to see three or four sudsy bubbles. I'll stick with Pears since my all-time favorite Marseilles LE CHAT cannot seem to found anywhere. I will not be buying this brand again.
Paid for a pack of 6 but got a single bar. Returned.
It works as stated, though it is a bit pricey for 3 bars of glycerine soap.
Un poco corrientes, pero para el precio supongo era de esperarse

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 7, 2016
reviews.reviewText: I've bought two lots of these so far and shall be getting more because they are, by far, the best soaps I've ever used. For years, I'd had a really bad skin condition on my hands til I started using these and it has cleared up!I noted some people's complaints of this soap that it has no lather. Well, it does - but as I've said before in other reviews - soaps tend to lather better in soft-water areas. A glycerine soap without a foaming agent, such as this, will produce little to no lather in a hard-water area. I'm in a soft-water area so the amount of lather this produces is fine for me. Also, because it hasn't a huge amount of lather, it washes off very quickly.What you do have to be aware of, though, is that like other glycerine soaps, this needs to be kept as dry as possible in between using it, so if you can, put it in a soap dish with drainer slats. Otherwise, what happens is that it will eventually absorb moisture and go cloudy and will begin to fall apart (this is common to all glycerine soaps).Edit, on 17th November 2019. I'd love to buy more of this soap from Amazon but the price has gone up and right at the moment it's not what I'm willing to pay. Maybe again in the future as I still love the soap.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on June 5, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: Lovely soap. I wash my hands a lot and ...
reviews.reviewText: Lovely soap. I wash my hands a lot and this doesn't dry them out as much as the normal pump type soaps you get in the shops.
